comment: The difference of an eventually upper bounded function and an eventually bounded function is eventually upper bounded. The "correct" sharp result here takes the second function to be eventually lower bounded instead of just bounded, but our notation for this is simply ` ( x e. A |-> -u C ) e. <_O(1) ` , so it is just a special case of ~ lo1add . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-May-2016.)
